design_audit.notes: Individual-level randomization, no clustering. Duration filter (>=250s) and gc==1 quality filter applied at data construction stage and cannot be varied post-hoc.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Intent to share alt-facts (fake news) on Facebook
claim_object.treatment_concept: Fact-checking interventions (imposed vs. voluntary) relative to alt-facts-only control
claim_object.estimand_concept: Average Treatment Effect (ITT) of fact-checking on desire to share alt-facts
claim_object.target_population: French Facebook users recruited via survey company for 2019 EU election experiment

baseline_specs.label: Table2-PanelA-Col2
baseline_specs.notes: Preferred spec with stratification controls only. Column 1 is no controls, col 2 adds strata (male + low_educ + mid_educ), col 3 adds strata+socio+vote+fb+i.educ, col 4 adds all. Col 2 is baseline.

baseline_specs.label: Table2-PanelA-Col6
baseline_specs.notes: Co-equal baseline using behavioral action outcome (2nd click: navigating to FB sharing page, tracked via Google Analytics). Columns 5-8 of Table 2 Panel A parallel Columns 1-4 with this outcome. Added as co-baseline by verifier to ensure equal robustness coverage for the action-level measure.

constraints.notes: Paper shows 4 control progressions from 0 to ~30 controls (full set includes strata+socio+vote+fb+behavioral+reported+all pre-treatment vars). Upper bound is approximate due to education dummies in i.educ. Strata controls (male, low_educ, mid_educ) are mandatory in all specs EXCEPT the pure diff-in-means design variant, as is standard for stratified RCTs. Sample filter (duration>=250s, gc==1) is baked into surveys.dta and cannot be varied post-hoc.

core_universe.removed_rc_rationale: Duration filter (>=250s) is applied during data construction in 1.infile_data.do before the durationinseconds variable is converted to minutes and the surveys.dta dataset is saved. The variable in the final dataset is in minutes with all sub-250s observations already excluded. Trim_300 cannot be applied post-hoc (requires re-running infile script from raw CSVs), and trim_200 would expand the sample beyond the already-applied 250s cutoff, which is also not possible from the generated data.

canonical.notes: Heteroskedasticity-robust HC1 SEs matching Stata robust option used throughout the paper.

variants.notes: HC3 small-sample correction as stress test.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Paper reports Table 1 balance and Table A1 omnibus mlogit test.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Intent to share fact-check on Facebook
claim_object.treatment_concept: Voluntary vs. imposed fact-check on willingness to share the fact-check itself
claim_object.estimand_concept: Average Treatment Effect (ITT) of voluntary vs imposed fact-check on fact-check sharing
claim_object.target_population: French Facebook users in the imposed and voluntary fact-check treatment arms

baseline_specs.label: Table2-PanelB-Col2
baseline_specs.notes: Sample restricted to surveys 2 and 3 (both fact-check arms). Coefficient on 3.survey is the treatment effect of voluntary vs imposed.

constraints.notes: Strata controls (male, low_educ, mid_educ) are mandatory in all specs EXCEPT the pure diff-in-means design variant, as is standard for stratified RCTs. Sample filter (duration>=250s, gc==1) is baked into surveys.dta and cannot be varied post-hoc.

variants.notes: HC3 small-sample correction as stress test.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Balance between survey 2 and 3 arms from Table 1.

treatment_var.survey: Treatment arm indicator: 1=Alt-Facts only, 2=Imposed Fact-Check, 3=Voluntary Fact-Check (main experiment). Values 4-6 are follow-up experiment, not used.
treatment_var.survey2: Dummy for Imposed Fact-Check (survey==2) vs Alt-Facts (survey==1) or Voluntary (survey==3)
treatment_var.survey3: Dummy for Voluntary Fact-Check (survey==3) vs Alt-Facts (survey==1) or Imposed (survey==2)

outcome_vars.want_share_fb: Binary: intent to share alt-facts on Facebook (1 click). Constructed from q29==1 (renamed from q34 in infile). Zero-filled for non-responders.
outcome_vars.share_click2: Continuous [0,1]: action of sharing alt-facts on Facebook (2 clicks, tracked via Google Analytics page view). Constructed as prob_view_fake = uniquepageviews/total_participants_fake, merged from GA_hours.dta. Zero-filled when missing.
outcome_vars.share_click3: Continuous [0,1]: reconfirm sharing alt-facts on Facebook (3 clicks, tracked via Google Analytics share count). Constructed as prob_share_GA_fake. Zero-filled when missing.
outcome_vars.want_share_facts: Binary: intent to share fact-check on Facebook (1 click). Constructed from q31==1 (renamed from q41). Zero-filled.
outcome_vars.share_facts_click2: Continuous [0,1]: action of sharing fact-check on Facebook (2 clicks, tracked via Google Analytics). Constructed as prob_view_fact. Zero-filled when missing. NOTE: use share_facts_click2 (not share_fact_click2) in regressions — the analysis code uses share_facts_click2 in Table 2 Panel B.
outcome_vars.share_fact_click3: Continuous [0,1]: reconfirm sharing fact-check on Facebook (3 clicks, tracked via Google Analytics share count). Constructed as prob_share_GA_fact. Zero-filled when missing.
outcome_vars.want_share_others: Binary: intent to share alt-facts with 100 other participants (not on Facebook). Constructed from q30==1. Used only in Table 3 panel FE analysis.

control_sets.socio_notes: The 'educ' variable (education level 1-9) is used as i.educ (factor/categorical) in column 3+ regressions, expanding to 8 dummies. age_sqrd = age*age. Drop 'age' in LOO specs means dropping both age and age_sqrd.

sample_filters.duration_250: durationinseconds >= 250 (applied at raw CSV import in 1.infile_data.do; CANNOT be varied post-hoc from surveys.dta — variable is subsequently converted to minutes and sub-250s obs are excluded before saving)
sample_filters.gc_filter: gc == 1 (applied at raw CSV import in 1.infile_data.do; CANNOT be varied post-hoc from surveys.dta)
